definition: to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: Eikenberry was in fact the commander of the Combined Forces Command Afghanistan (CFC-A).
sentences.chinese: 艾肯伯里实际上是驻阿富汗联军司令部司令官。

sentences.english: The captains report to the commandant that they are ready to accomplish their tasks.
sentences.chinese: 舰长向司令官汇报他们已经做好完成任务的准备。

sentences.english: The general was relieved of his office as a supreme commander.
sentences.chinese: 将军被解除了作为一名最高司令官的职位。

sentences.english: I was company commander in the National Guard for seven years here in Salina.
sentences.chinese: 我在Salina的国家护卫队做了7年的司令官。

sentences.english: The commander off Yin Mingzhu, he wants to talk to Xu Darong personally.
sentences.chinese: 司令官支走尹明珠，他要亲自和徐大荣谈。

sentences.english: Combat Operations Centers are the focal point of decision-making for Marine Corps commanders and their staffs.
sentences.chinese: 战斗作战中心是海军陆战队司令官及参谋的决策焦点。

sentences.english: Napoleon's commanders insisted that he give up the throne.
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑的司令官们也坚决主张他放弃帝位。
徐大荣对司令官充满感激。

sentences.english: There is an Iraqi commander who is fighting in the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 有一个伊拉克来的司令官，他在山里作战。

sentences.english: ALate that day the young man reached Orenburg and presented himself to the general in command.
sentences.chinese: 当天傍晚，年轻人到达奥伦堡，向司令官报到。

sentences.english: The Commandant has had a rotten day.
sentences.chinese: 司令官这一天过得真倒楣。

sentences.english: The order from the commander was that the troops should set off for the front immediately.
sentences.chinese: 司令官的命令是部队立即开拔去前线。

sentences.english: Allen is the latest in a string of commanders of ISAF.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦将军是最新的一位国家安全援助部队的司令官。

sentences.english: The medallion makes me a commander in the order of arts and letters.
sentences.chinese: 我现在是全部法国艺术和文字的司令官了。

sentences.english: The grand commander demands thousands of sandy sandwiches.
sentences.chinese: 大司令官要成千个沙色三明治。

definition: commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
high ranking officer in Chinese army/colonel
middle ranking officer in Chinese army/lieutenant colonel/commander
senior official/senior officer/commanding officer/CL:位[wei4]/sir (term of address for senior officer)
junior ranking officer in Chinese army/major/lieutenant commander
